description: Size of range of occurrences of digits in decimal expansion of Pi.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: a(50)=9-1=8 because 3 appears 9 times in the first 50 digits of pi, 0 appears once and other digits are between these two.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 08 2000
